alert.note: Alert for Southern Nassau (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 2:53PM EDT until July 02 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT EDT MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline for this evening and the Monday evening high tide cycle. * WHERE...Southern Nassau County. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 PM to 11 PM EDT this evening. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM Monday to midnight EDT Monday night. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect around 1 foot of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional rounds of minor flooding are possible with the evening high tide cycle through midweek. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. EAST ROCKAWAY INLET AT ATLANTIC BEACH NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 6.0 FT, MODERATE 7.0 FT, MAJOR 8.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.0 FT, MODERATE 2.0 FT, MAJOR 3.0 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/08 PM 6.0/ 6.5 1.0/ 1.5 0.2/ 0.8 3 MINOR 03/08 AM 4.5/ 5.0 -0.6/-0.1 0.1/ 0.6 3 NONE 03/09 PM 6.0/ 6.5 1.0/ 1.5 0.2/ 0.7 3-0 MINOR 04/09 AM 4.6/ 5.1 -0.5/ 0.0 0.1/ 0.6 3 NONE 04/09 PM 5.9/ 6.4 0.9/ 1.4 0.1/ 0.6 3 MINOR 05/10 AM 4.7/ 5.2 -0.2/ 0.2 0.2/ 0.7 2 NONE REYNOLDS CHANNEL AT POINT LOOKOUT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.8 FT, MODERATE 6.8 FT, MAJOR 7.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.1 FT, MODERATE 2.1 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/08 PM 5.6/ 6.1 0.9/ 1.4 0.2/ 0.7 3 MINOR 03/08 AM 4.6/ 5.1 -0.2/ 0.3 0.5/ 1.0 3-0 NONE 03/09 PM 5.6/ 6.1 0.9/ 1.4 0.1/ 0.6 4 MINOR 04/09 AM 4.7/ 5.2 0.1/ 0.6 0.5/ 1.0 3 NONE 04/09 PM 6.0/ 6.5 1.3/ 1.8 0.5/ 1.0 3 MINOR 05/10 AM 5.0/ 5.5 0.2/ 0.8 0.6/ 1.1 2 NONE HUDSON BAY AT FREEPORT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 6.0 FT, MODERATE 6.5 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.0 FT, MAJOR 2.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/08 PM 5.8/ 6.3 1.3/ 1.8 1.9/ 2.4 1 MINOR 03/09 AM 4.9/ 5.4 0.4/ 0.9 1.9/ 2.3 1 NONE 03/09 PM 5.8/ 6.3 1.3/ 1.8 1.8/ 2.3 1 MINOR 04/10 AM 5.0/ 5.5 0.5/ 1.0 1.9/ 2.3 1 NONE 04/10 PM 5.8/ 6.3 1.3/ 1.7 1.7/ 2.2 1 MINOR 05/10 AM 5.1/ 5.6 0.6/ 1.1 2.0/ 2.5 0 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
